**Crystal plate mail** is a type of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [glass](/wiki/Glass "Glass").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [5.4 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [5.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and armor shops can stock crystal plate mail.

A set of crystal plate mail is always generated in one of the niches on the middle floor of [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower").

[Mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") with a target [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of -1 or better (e.g., [Yendorian Army](/wiki/Yendorian_Army "Yendorian Army") [lieutenants](/wiki/Lieutenant "Lieutenant")) have an effective 4⁄25 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") crystal plate mail.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[Player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian_\(player_monster\) "Barbarian (player monster)"), [knights](/wiki/Knight_\(player_monster\) "Knight (player monster)"), [priests](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)"), and [valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie_\(player_monster\) "Valkyrie (player monster)") have an effective 1⁄62 chance (roughly \~1.61%) of forcing crystal plate mail in place of their initial body armor.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Description

While worn, crystal plate mail provides 7 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [MC2](/wiki/MC2 "MC2"), similar to [plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail"). As armor made of glass, it is [fragile](/wiki/Fragile "Fragile") and can be broken easily unless worn.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit e9c58c2f](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/e9c58c2fe4277fc64433df3c9a2e8d954fd1d16a), crystal plate mail and other glass armor do not instantly shatter, with the cracking being treated as a form of [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion") - a glass piece of armor that has three levels of erosion will be destroyed the next time something would damage it.

Per [commit 5e572d3d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/5e572d3d5f2581d14c29bd0071c6be0d7fbdce5e), the weight of crystal plate mail is reduced to 415 aum in order to properly match weight differences between materials.

## Strategy

Crystal plate mail is the second-highest source of AC in the game that does not inhibit [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") after [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), and is immune to erosion. However, it is seldom used in practice primarily due to its weight: roles who would most benefit from it typically lack the [carrying capacity](/wiki/Carrying_capacity "Carrying capacity") to reliably carry one, since most roles tailored for spellcasting start with low [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"). Most [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") and other casters that could raise their strength to a sufficient level to consider wearing crystal plate will either have: A) a means of obtaining dragon scale mail, or B) a low enough [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") that the additional protection is not worth the weight penalty.

Characters with high strength will usually prefer a [dwarvish mithril-coat](/wiki/Dwarvish_mithril-coat "Dwarvish mithril-coat") until they obtain dragon scale mail, and even wearing an [elven mithril-coat](/wiki/Elven_mithril-coat "Elven mithril-coat") frees up 300 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") of weight in the inventory while providing only two fewer points of base AC. Characters who do not wish to use metallic armor will usually prefer a [studded leather armor](/wiki/Studded_leather_armor "Studded leather armor"). Players still willing to try out crystal plate mail will have to be diligent in their inventory management to avoid being burdened too often.

As crystal plate mail is easily broken unless worn, be careful when handling it: in particular, beware of using [force bolts](/wiki/Spellbook_of_force_bolt "Spellbook of force bolt") or a [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") near a shop selling crystal plate mail, since most early characters will not be able to pay off the [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") if they break any.

Of note is that crystal plate mail has an irregular base price of 820[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm"), which should be accounted for when [price-identifying](/wiki/Price-identify "Price-identify") armor for enchantments.

## History

Crystal plate mail first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d").

## Variants

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") get a weight reduction for any body armor heavier than [studded leather armor](/wiki/Studded_leather_armor "Studded leather armor"), making crystal plate mail a more feasible option for them in particular.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), crystal plate mail grants 3 AC and 3 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") while worn, but does not confer magic cancellation, and its weight is reduced to 170 aum. For [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), crystal plate mail is known as **"jade o-yoroi"**.

Crystal plate mail can safely be enchanted to +7 and adds its full enchantment as a bonus to both AC and DR, rather than half of its enchantment to each as with other armor - dNetHack also introduces crystal armor for each part of the body, which has the same traits.

Crystal plate mail can be found in the second-to-last floor of the [Windowless Tower](/wiki/Windowless_Tower "Windowless Tower").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), while crystal plate mail is not changed directly, armor with glass as its base material can be shatter-proofed through the usual methods of erosion-proofing armor (e.g. reading a [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") while confused). Worn armor is also subject to a 1⁄4 weight reduction, making crystal plate mail slightly more viable.

Dragon scale mail is replaced with dragon-scaled armor in xNetHack, significantly changing which armor is viable or even "optimal" for a given character; crystal plate mail is likely to be overlooked in favor of comparable mail with a lighter material, such as [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone") or [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril"), for use with dragon scales.

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, [Ymir](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\)#Ymir.2C_Lord_of_the_Grassless_Gap "Spirits (dNetHack)") is generated with a +10 [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") set of crystal plate mail known as the [Plates of the Near Void](/wiki/Plates_of_the_Near_Void "Plates of the Near Void") when summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), crystal plate mail is changed considerably: Its weight is reduced to 150 aum, and its base material is [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone") instead of glass, making it immune to erosion (which includes shattering). It is also immune to disintegration and the revamped [destroy armor](/wiki/Destroy_armor_\(monster_spell\) "Destroy armor (monster spell)") monster spell, which can now erode armor even if the target has [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") or the armor is made of an inherently erosionproof material.

EvilHack applies a spellcasting penalty to all roles for any worn body armor similar to [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), with crystal plate mail as the sole exception. Dragon scale mail is replaced with dragon-scaled armor in EvilHack as well, and crystal plate mail is among the most enticing armor to merge dragon scales into.

High-ranking mercenaries of a [race](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") that can wear body armor have a chance of generating with crystal plate mail as usual. The [Paladin](/wiki/Paladin_\(monster\) "Paladin (monster)"), the [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis"), will always generate with crystal plate mail.

The [Armor of Retribution](/wiki/Armor_of_Retribution "Armor of Retribution") is an intelligent artifact set of crystal plate mail that can only be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining [The Sword of Annihilation](/wiki/The_Sword_of_Annihilation "The Sword of Annihilation") and [Ashmar](/wiki/Ashmar "Ashmar").

3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 201](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L201): *body armor for knights*
